name: Equipment Delivery Verification
Sighted by Scentre Group
Framing/Sheeting
Survey/Wall Framing
Confirm set-out of walls in correct locations & cross check with surveyors grids.
Confirm wall set-out plan/revision used for set-out
Confirm that 1m benchmark has been reviewed and agreed. Ensure it is marked on most relevant permanent structure.
Attach photo of 1m benchmark for reference.
Review wall types are installed correctly per architectural wall type details.
Review wet area framing to ensure square and plumb to take tiling.

Strengthening Requirements - Confirm all noggins, trimming blocks and struts have been appropriately installed to support the following items (Min. 12mm structural plywood). Ensure to cross check relevant drawings:
Appliances (Wall mounted dryers, etc…)
Bathroom Accessories (Robe hooks, towel rails, shower shelves, toilet roll holders, adaptable handrails, etc…)
Bathroom Furniture (Mirror Cabinets, Vanity Basins, shower roses, etc…)
Services (pendant lighting, display screens, TV areas, etc…)
Adaptable Apartments - Check blocking installed to cater for post adaptation layouts
Confirm that all framing is square at corners (check top, middle & bottom of frame junctions)
Confirm studs not bridging or touching hydraulic pipes, mechanical units, columns in intertenancy walls or lift shaft walls to ensure vibration is not transferred through walls
Deflection Requirements - Ensure gap is present (10-15mm) at top of stud inside head track
Joinery Openings - check gaps between framing to joinery + wall finishes will fit (5mm tolerance)
Stud Spacing - Spot check studwork is spaced at 600mm maximum per Architectural Specification. Check additional studwork reinforcement at openings (ie; double studwork).
Staggered Studs (if required) - to be installed at 300mm centres alternating per architectural specification
Movement Joints - check walls are discontinued where they pass over building movement joints.
Services Risers - Ensure stud and trackwork is kept a minimum of 20mm away from vertical services within risers per acoustic specification
Engineered Designs - Spot check any engineered framing designs and attached engineers review and sign-off on system.
Wall Sheeting
Confirm acoustic/thermal insulation installed to achieve design ratings
Cross check product ratings against architectural insulation plans
Confirm there is a minimum of 45mm cavity between the residential intertenancy wall studwork per Acoustic Details/Wall type Plans
Confirm door frames are installed vertical and plumb and at correct height.
Check metal door frames in wet areas are outside of membrane zone (ie; notched accordingly).
Check plasterboard sheets installed with 10-15mm gap at top and bottom to allow for deflection and fire sealant.
Control Joints - Ensure controls joints installed in wall runs larger than 12m in length.
Check correct plasterboard linings installed (type and thickness) per architectural wall types
Ensure sheets are staggered on multiple sheet layer walls. Stagger all sheet joints by minimum 200mm per architectural specification.
Confirm plasterboard lining installed to wet areas are sealed up to concrete soffit on both sides of wall where adjacent to habitable rooms.
Confirm all services penetrations through wet area walls adjacent to habitable rooms are sealed and caulked for acoustic performance.
Check that mechanical flex ducts are not passing through walls - to be rigid ductwork or sleave installed over.
Check intertenancy walls extend to façade panels, leave 10-15mm gap and caulked with fire sealant.
HOLD POINT - Confirm Acoustic Consultant Inspection Completed prior to sheeting
Sheeting Ceilings
Confirm ceiling insulation complete where applicable
Confirm provisions made in ceiling framing for access panels and air grilles were required by architectural RCP
Spot check access panels installed to allow access to fire dampers and mechanical fans
Confirm ceiling framing bulkheads are square and level
Confirm furring channels do not clash with other services (eg; downlights, access panels, mechanical exhaust, sprinkler heads, etc…).
Control Joints - Ensure ceiling bays are not larger than 10m x 7m without a joint or wall break.
Attach Subcontractor ITP for the Works
HOLD POINT - Confirm Acoustic Consultant Inspection Completed prior to sheeting
Review & Sign-off by Acoustic Consultant
HOLD POINT - Confirm BCA consultant inspection of services penetrations through fire rated walls prior to sheeting ceilings
Review & Sign-off by BCA consultant
Final Sign-off Complete
Final ITP Review & Sign-off by Project Engineer
01C-SDC-TMP-CON-ITP-007a - 3 - Jumpform
Prior to Reinforcement
Confirm Jump No Seq and bottom and top RLs of proposed pour
Jump No Sequence
Bottom of Proposed Wall RL
Top of Proposed Wall RL
Surveyor to complete survey of concrete walls below to confirm if walls need to be adjusted. Attach confirmation survey has been issued to formwork contractor via Aconex
Aconex Correspondence No.
Lift Requirements - Review formwork blockouts for lift openings and door thresholds in accordance with architectural elevations and lift shop drawings
Formwork Requirements - Confirm that all reboxes, couplers, shear key pockets and cast in plates to internal shutter as per structural engineer detail
Attach Sign Off from form worker contractor confirming all works completed and clear access for handover to steel fixers
Prior to Closing Shutters
Lift Requirements - Confirm any block out / penetrations required for lift buttons and indicators has been cast in by Form Worker
Confirm all outside reboxes & couplers are installed to required SSL + cover levels
Attach electrical contractors ITP to confirm any required conduit cast ins are completed
Attach reinforcement installer’s ITP
Reinforcement Checks (Refer Structural Engineers Drawings for Reference):
Reinforcement cover sufficient
Lap Length of bars sufficient
Starter bar length to next pour correct
Lace bars installed to reboxes
Attach structural engineer’s inspection report
Attach verification that structural engineer’s inspection report has been closed out to allow concrete pour
Attach photos of all works completed prior to closing shutters
During Concrete Pouring
Confirm Concrete ordered is correct
MPa/mix design
Confirm pour height with concrete Contractor prior to pouring
Attach form worker’s jumpform ITP
Attach concrete place contractor’s ITP
Confirm concrete tester onsite to take samples and ensure correct pour location is recorded
Prior to Jumping
Attach concrete test result to confirm min 15 MPa has been reached
Attach form worker’s Permit to Energise Jumpform.
Note exclusion zone below and all penetrations to be blocked up and secure and any temporary services (hydraulic/electrical/static line) disconnected inside trailing decks
After Jumping
Form Worker to ensure that all z bar holes and jumpform pockets within the lift shaft has been patched and infilled in accordance with structural engineer drawings
Attach concrete test results 28d and confirm compliance with engineer requirements
Permit to Re-seat jumpform received (attach to ITP)
Surveyor to survey finished concrete walls (attach as-built to ITP)
Final ITP Review & Sign-off by Project Engineer
101C-SDC-TMP-CON-ITP-007 - 2- Concrete Columns Walls Verticals
Prior to Concrete Pour
Current Drawing Status - Refer Aconex Document Register for latest approved Shop Drawings. Record drawings used at time of pour on ITP.
Architectural Drawings
Structural Drawings
Ensure survey of column/wall positions are completed prior to commencing formwork
Attach surveyors as-built records to ITP
Reinforcement - Check Starter bars from previous pour installed in correct position (compare against survey points)
Reinforcement - Check for correct bar sizes and lap lengths between starter bars (top & bottom)
Cast-in Services - Electrical subcontractor to sign off that all Conduits / block-outs are installed in accordance with the design. Attach Contractors ITP
Cast-in Services - Hydraulics subcontractor to sign off that all Conduits / block-outs are installed in accordance with the design Attach Contractors ITP
Cast-in Services - Mechanical subcontractor to sign off that all Conduits / block-outs are installed in accordance with the design Attach Contractors ITP
Cast-in Services - Fire Subcontractor to sign off that all Conduits / block-outs are installed in accordance with the design Attach Contractors ITP
Cast-in Services - Security Subcontractor to sign off that all Conduits / block-outs are installed in accordance with the design
Confirm strength and mix design of concrete ordered with subcontractor prior to pour
Concrete Mix Design:
Structural Engineer Sign-off - Foreman and subcontractor to sign off engineer’s report to verify that all work to be rectified was checked for compliance prior to pour
Attach engineers inspection report and verification of rectification items being closed out.
Formwork Compliance - Confirm formwork is checked to achieve Class 2 finish to concrete:
Formwork is clean and free of debris
No lipping of formwork between sheets
Fillets installed at all corners
Form ties are installed at even spacing
Check for correct reo cover at shutters
Splayed columns are at correct degrees per Architectural/Structural drawings
Area cleaned of all excess formwork, sawdust at base of columns, reo, and debris prior to pour
Attach formworkers ITP for column and wall formworking
Attach Steelfixers ITP for Column and wall reinforcement
During Concrete Pour
Concrete Placement Checklist
Structural Engineer & Formwork Engineer Sign-off Received
Confirm Delivery Docket References correct mix design
Plant and Equipment checklist completed on concrete pump and lines
Confirm concrete tester on-site and correct location of concrete pour provided to them for test results
7, 28 & 56 day compressive test results to be issued by batch plant
Batch plant to issue monthly dry shrinkage test results
Ensure a representative from each of the following is on site and witnessing the pour:
Form Worker
Electrician
Plumber
Ensure only rubber tipped vibrators are used and care is taken not to damage shutters
Ensure Form Worker labour is available to clean up any slurry runs at bottom of walls, immediately after pour for off form finishes.
Attach Concrete Place contractors ITP
After Concrete Pour
Curing - Approved curing compound to be applied to columns following removal of formwork as required.
Confirm tolerance of finished concrete surfaces:
5mm+/- in correct position
5mm +/- from 3.0m straight edges.
5mm +/- from plumb.
As-Built Survey - Confirm Surveyor is out next day to carry out survey of finished concrete. Attach As Built Survey Plan
Concrete Test Results - Obtain all concrete test results. Confirm strength achieved after:
7 Days MPa
28 Days MPa
56 Days MPa
All non-conformances closed out
Final ITP Review & Sign-off by Project Engineer
Drawings / Documents
Approved Drawing Available
Fit Off
Approved for Sheeting/Closure
Fit Off Complete
SDC-TMP-CON-ITP-006 - 4 – Pits, Pads and Strip Footings
Template Name: SDC-TMP-CON-ITP-006 - 4 – Pits, Pads and Strip Footings

name: Prior to Concrete Pour - Attach markup structural plan identifying footings relevant to this ITP
Prior to Concrete Pour - Confirm surveyor has provided setout for pad footing excavation (attach survey setout plan)
Prior to Concrete Pour - Attach Geotech engineer bearing certification confirming approval of substrate complying with engineer’s requirements
Prior to Concrete Pour - Confirm that either pre- applied membrane or Forecoin plastic has been installed to comply with electrolysis study (attach photos)
Prior to Concrete Pour - Confirm excavation is free of debris and loose materials to walls and floor prior to handover (attach photos)
Prior to Concrete Pour - Attach reinforcement contractors ITP (incl AEFAC Accredited installer signoff of any drill and epoxy bars to comply with structural engineer details)
Prior to Concrete Pour - Confirm wall starter bars have been installed in accordance with surveyor setout and architectural outline drawings.
Prior to Concrete Pour - Attach signoff from CFT Column contractor inspection approval of starter bars, castins and hold down bolts
Prior to Concrete Pour - Attach waterproofing contractors ITP confirm tanking waterproofing and PVC water bar has been installed(attach waterproofing ITP)
Prior to Concrete Pour - Confirm that waterproofing consultant has inspected works and defects closed out
Prior to Concrete Pour - Attach hydraulic contractor's ITP confirming completion of any cast in as per hydraulic drawings
Prior to Concrete Pour - Attach formwork ITP/Signoff that all formwork to kicker has been completed (sump, hobs, edge boards etc)
Prior to Concrete Pour - Attach structural engineer’s inspection report
Prior to Concrete Pour - Attach verification that structural engineer’s inspection report has been closed out to allow concrete pour
Prior to Concrete Pour - Confirm concrete place contractor's order complies with engineer's strength of concrete, waterproofing additive and testing requirements
Prior to Concrete Place - Attach photo of formwork setting the level for concrete place contractor
Prior to Concrete Pour - Attach concrete place contractor’s ITP
After Concrete Pour - Confirm RL of poured footing complies with design RLs
After Concrete Pour - Confirm integrals falls have been completed in concrete to sump
After Concrete Pour - Attach concrete test results and confirm compliance with engineer requirements
Signoffs - Site Engineer to signoff ITP has been completed
Signoff by Site Engineer
Signoffs - Project Engineer to review and confirm ITP has been completed
Signoff by Project Engineer
Rough In
Rough In Complete
101C-SDC-TMP-CON-ITP-008 - 3 - Suspended Concrete Slab
Prior to Formwork Deck Handover
Current Drawing Status - Refer Aconex Document Register for latest approved Shop Drawings. Record drawings used at time of pour on ITP.
Architectural Drawings
Structural Drawings
Concrete Mix Design
Confirm Mix Design
Set-out - Surveyor set out slab grids to allow formwork construction
Survey & Set-out of formwork correct. Check correct heights for formwork soffit, Top of Concrete (TOC) and falls
Attach Surveyor Formwork As-Built to ITP
Site Instructions - Copies of design changes, emails and site advices and the like to be attached.
Bondek (where applicable) - Back propping installed for pre pour and deflection & gaps sealed to prevent dripping
Structural Steel Sign off from Steel installer and Structural Engineer (where applicable for bondek slabs)
Formwork Sign-off - Area cleaned of all excess formwork, sawdust, reo and debris prior to pour. Safe Access to deck available.materials before handover deck
Attach formworkers ITP (referencing all hobs, steps, cast-ins, HDB's, bearing strips, polystyrene, fillets, etc… installed correctly)
Prior to Concrete Pour
Structural Compliance - Engineers approval for concrete placement required with list of defects to be completed
Attach structural engineers inspection report and evidence of close-out
Formwork Engineers Sign-off - Attach Sign-off
Post Tensioning - Check Subcontractor ITP complete, and attach to this ITP.
Screen Needle Cast-in's - Inspect all screen needles are installed in accordance with relevant shop drawings
Attach sign-off from Formworker
Curtain Wall Bracket Cast-in's - Inspect all Curtain wall brackets/rebates are installed in accordance with relevant shop drawings. Surveyor to confirm locations are correct.
Attach Curtain Wall subcontractors sign-off & ITP from formworker
Crane/Hoist Bracket Cast-in's - Inspect all hoist and crane brackets are installed in accordance with relevant shop drawings. Surveyor to confirm locations are correct.
Hoist and Crane contractor to inspect and sign-off cast-in position.
Temporary Penetrations - Inspect formwork penetrations in accordance with temporary works design. Surveyor to confirm locations are correct.
Temporary Penetrations may include: formwork hoist, concrete boom, etc…
In-Slab Services - Electrical subcontractor to sign off that all penetrations are installed in accordance with the design. Attach contractors ITP
In-Slab Services - Hydraulic subcontractor to sign off that all penetrations are installed in accordance with the design. Attach contractors ITP
In-Slab Services - Mechanical subcontractor to sign off that all penetrations are installed in accordance with the design. Attach contractors ITP
In-Slab Services - Fire Subcontractor to sign off that all penetrations are installed in accordance with the design. Attach contractors ITP
In-Slab Services - Security Subcontractor to sign off that all penetrations are installed in accordance with the design. Attach contractors ITP
Formwork Cast-ins - All timber fillets, drip grooves, Rebates, and proprietary shear connectors installed as required
Starter Bars - Confirm all starter bars for walls and columns installed as required per structural and architectural drawings and survey pins
Water Stops - Confirm installation of any proprietary water stops as required (ie; at CJ’s, etc…)

Reinforcement Cover - Check top RLs for all reinforcement, ensuring adequate concrete cover. Confirm with Concreter. Confirm that plastic bar chairs are used everywhere, particularly at exposed off-form soffits.
Attach Reinforcement contractors ITP
Concrete Falls - Check if concrete has falls, and ensure shutters, timbers, spacers are used to create folds where necessary
Cross-check the following drawings: See Hydraulic, Architectural Concrete Outlines and Structural drawings
Cleaning of Deck - Clean off decks and beams prior to pour and ensure all exposed off-form soffits are free of any dust, stains, and rust marks. Hose down if necessary.
During Concrete Pour
Concrete Placement Checklist
Structural Engineer & Formwork Engineer Sign-off Received
Confirm Delivery Docket References correct mix design
Plant and equipment checklist completed on concrete pump and lines
Confirm concrete tester on-site and correct location of concrete pour provided to them for test results
1, 4, 7, 28 & 56 day compressive test results to be issued by batch plant
Concrete Finish - Ensure concrete contractor is aware of required concrete surface finish.
Slab Curing - Check cured when bleed water stops and able to access slab without marking and also amount used complies
Concrete Falls - Confirm concrete has falls to drainage points in slab.
Attach Concrete Place Contractors ITP
Trade Representatives - Ensure a representative from each of the following is on site and witnessing the pour:
Form Worker
Electrician
Plumber
Post Tensioner
Confirm Form Worker has labour below deck inspecting all joints (particularly at columns & walls) and is immediately cleaning any slurry.
After Concrete Pour
Confirm Surveyor is out next day to carry out survey of finished concrete. Attach As built Survey Plan.
Confirm tolerance of finished concrete surfaces are as follows:
6mm +/- from design RL
6mm +/- from 3.0m straight edges
Exposed Concrete Finish - Confirm finish of concrete is adequate for application (broom/trowel/helicopter finish), refer to AS3610 (Class 1, 2 or 3)
Concrete Test Results - Note test results on ITP and attach:
1 Day
4 Day
7 Day
28 Day
56 Day
Initial Stressing - Concrete has achieved required strength MPa (10 MPa and confirmed by Concrete contractor)
Concrete Contractor must issue Concrete test results, verbal not accepted
Final Stressing - Concrete has achieved required strength Mpa (22 Mpa and confirmed by concrete contractor)
Concrete Contractor must issue Concrete test results, verbal not accepted
Stressing Sign-off - Before stripping can commence final stress complete, Ducts grouted and PT supervisor issues verification records
Attach Post Tension Contractors ITP
Extension Records Approval - Engineer approval of extension records following final stress
Record date when props were removed if not given approval by engineer
All non-conformances closed out and accepted by Structural Engineer and Architect.
Final ITP Review & Sign-off by Project Engineer
SDC-TMP-CON-ITP-009 - 3 – RC Slab on Grade
Prior to Reinforcement: Attach Markup to confirm proposed pour zone
Prior to Reinforcement: Ensure detailed excavation is complete (Attach Excavation Contractor’s ITP)
Prior to Reinforcement: Confirm inground drainage and pit works has been completed and backfilled (Attach photos/confirmation)
Prior to Reinforcement: Confirm that substation earthing rods have been drilled, as AS Built red line survey (If applicable)
Prior to Reinforcement: Confirm min 100mm subsoil drainage has been installed as per geotechnical requirements (attach contractor’s ITP)
Prior to Reinforcement: Confirm Surveyor has provided set outs/ benchmarks (Attach survey)
Prior to Reinforcement: Confirm vapor barrier installed over subbase (Attach photos and confirm signed off by concrete place ITP)

Prior to Concrete Pour: Attach Structural Engineers inspection report
Prior to Concrete Pour: Attach Verification that structural engineer’s inspection report has been closed out to allow concrete pour (Attach Photos)
Prior to Concrete Pour: Attach reinforcement contractor’s ITP
Prior to Concrete Pour: Attach Hydraulic ITP (inground drainage and pipework)
Prior to Concrete Pour: Attach Electrical ITP (Cast in conduits – if applicable)
During Concrete Pour: Attach Concrete place contractor’s ITP (including Ableflex)
After Concrete Pour: Confirm falls have been completed in concrete pour in accordance to architectural drawings
After Concrete Pour: Attach Concrete test results and confirm compliance with engineer requirements
After Concrete Pour: Confirm saw cuts installed as per engineer’s drawings
Signoffs: Site Engineer to signoff ITP has been completed
Signoff by Site Engineer
Signoffs: Project Engineer to review and confirm ITP has been completed
Signoff by Project Engineer
101C-SDC-TMP-CON-ITP-007b - 3 - Stairs FRP Works
Prior to Concrete Pour
Confirm bottom, mid & top of stair RL's on Architectural Concrete Outlines.
Bottom Landing RL
Mid Landing RL
Top Landing RL
Confirm Re-boxes/cast-in bars are installed to correct heights at landings, based on nominated design RL's.
Confirm any starter bars on landings for dividing walls, etc… are installed as per Structural Drawings
Check for reinforcement cover as per Structural Drawings.
Cover requirement generally 30mm
Confirm all cast in elements installed (eg, stair handrails, etc…)
Confirm all formwork is clean and free of debris.
Confirm any conventional parts of stairs have been formed in accordance with the relevant shop drawings and standards.
Statutory Requirements (Dimensions in mm): Riser: Min. 115, Max. 190 Going: Min. 240, Max. 355 Ensure consistency
Confirm cast-in of anti-slip items if required (eg, carborundum powder, stair nosings, etc…);
Obtain certificate from Structural Engineer prior to concrete pour and attached completed Inspection Report.
Confirm MPa, slump and agg. size of concrete prior to ordering.
Concrete Mpa/Mix Design
Obtain subcontractors ITP (Steel Fixer) & attach to ITP
Obtain subcontractors ITP (Form Worker) & attach to ITP
During Concrete Pour
If the stairs are being used as access to a leading deck, ensure alternative access is established prior to pouring.
Confirm concrete tester onsite during concrete pour, and the following tests have been requested.
7 Day
28 Day
Ensure concrete tester is aware of pour locations
Ensure a representative from each of the following is on site and witnessing the pour:
Form Worker
Electrician
Plumber / Fire services
Ensure concreters have correct finishing tools (eg, carborundum powder, etc…).
Ensure only rubber tipped vibrators are used to prevent formwork damage.
Obtain Subcontractors ITP (Concretor) & attach to this ITP
Ensure Form Worker labour is available to clean up any slurry runs at bottom of stairs, immediately after pour.
After Concrete Pour
Confirm tolerance of finished concrete surfaces:
6mm +/- from design RL
6mm +/- from 3.0m straight edges.
If an as-built survey is required, confirm Surveyor is out next day to carry out survey of finished concrete. Attach As built Survey Plan
Obtain all concrete tests at 7 days. Attach to ITP
Obtain all concrete tests at 28 days. Attach to ITP
Final ITP Review & Sign-off by Project Engineer
